p: Brown marmorated stink bug (BMSB), Halyomorpha halys (St√•l, 1855) (Hemiptera: Pentatomidae) is a highly polyphagous insect, which feeds on more than 300 host plants [ 1, 2]. BMSB has been causing extensive damage to a wide variety of agricultural crops and poses a global economic threat for agricultural and horticultural industry [ 3, 4]. As per 2010 reports, the economic losses caused by BMSB valued more than 37 million USD in North America [ 5]. BMSB is capable of long-distance flight as well as local walking dispersal during the growing season [ 6, 7]. They are also considered nuisance pests as adults search for human-made structures to overwinter and discharge an unpleasant and long-lasting odor once disturbed [ 8].
